body:
For cd diagrams, we could consider helping this repository
https://github.com/hfawaz/cd-diagram
to become a proper pypi package?

I'm not sure Hassan is still maintaining that repo, and I don't think we want to add it as a dependency. Better to adapt the matlab linked to above. @SveaMeyer13 the function criticaldifference.m does it the original way, criticaldifferencePairwise.m takes the cliques as input. Actually finding the p-values and then finding cliques are separate tasks
hm, this closely relates to @RNKuhns´s issue #1175 (which I wanted to give some input on later this week) - you get different CD for different tests, so there is a direct interface point.
See my comment on that thread already :)

Hmm, I just figured that the benchmarking module already contains a function `plot_critical_difference_diagram()`. How exactly is my task different from what is done there? Can't we just use that? 

https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/sktime/benchmarking/evaluation.py : line 526 onwards

oops - perhaps you really want to sit together with @ViktorKaz then, and plan, as I recommended?
The benchmarking module could also use some extension/refactor at some point.

yes, this is right, critical difference diagrams are already implemented. Initially, I was relying on [Orange](https://orangedatamining.com/) for the CD plots. At some point it was decided that we didn't want Orange as a dependency in sktime and @mloning implemented the method that you are referring to. I think the method does exactly what @TonyBagnall is describing but you can maybe double check that it behaves as you expect before closing the issue.

I had not seen this, although @mloning made some reference to his implementation which he couldnt find, I'm not sure why this is a class function rather than a static function, seems a bit OO for sktime. This does not function in the way I would like (input accuracies or errors, get a graph) and it does not input the errors or accuracies nor does it input cliques. @SveaMeyer13 I think your method will be much easier to use in stand alone code.

yes, and in the stand-up today I also suggested that perhaps the evaluator class should be refactored to call the standalone code instead of implementing the logic inside. Which may imply that it might be good to make a comparison between the functionality in the evaluator and outside.

I agree, but I think there is quite a lot to do there, and I think a roadmap for benchmarking  would be good. But it is not a high priority for me right now, I am focussing on improving classification and clustering

issue.title: Critical Difference Diagrams

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
Fixes #1186

Adds functionality to plot a critical difference diagram.

As discussed the entire calculation of critical differences and cliques as well as the plotting happens within one standalone function. 

Coding style checks will fail due to hard-coded qalpha values.
